body:
### Problem

With treesitter installed and enabled, set the following options:

```lua
vim.opt.foldenable = false
vim.opt.foldmethod = 'expr'
vim.opt.foldexpr = 'v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()'
```

Install treesitter with the following options:

```lua
opts = {
	auto_install = true,
	highlight = {
		enable = true,
	},
	incremental_selection = {
		enable = true,
		keymaps = {
			init_selection = '<c-i>',
			node_incremental = '<c-i>',
			scope_incremental = false,
			node_decremental = '<bs>',
		},
	},
	indent = {
		enable = true,
	},
}
```

1. Modify a git-tracked file inside neovim and save it. Leave the buffer visible and open.
2. In a separate terminal, restore the file using git restore
3. Go back to neovim

It will hang with high cpu utilization.

### Steps to reproduce

With treesitter installed and enabled, set the following options:

```lua
vim.opt.foldenable = false
vim.opt.foldmethod = 'expr'
vim.opt.foldexpr = 'v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()'
```

Install treesitter with the following options:

```lua
opts = {
	auto_install = true,
	highlight = {
		enable = true,
	},
	incremental_selection = {
		enable = true,
		keymaps = {
			init_selection = '<c-i>',
			node_incremental = '<c-i>',
			scope_incremental = false,
			node_decremental = '<bs>',
		},
	},
	indent = {
		enable = true,
	},
}
```

1. Modify a git-tracked file inside neovim and save it. Leave the buffer visible and open.
2. In a separate terminal, restore the file using git restore
3. Go back to neovim

It will hang with high cpu utilization.

### Expected behavior

No hang.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.9.4

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

NA

### Operating system/version

Arch Linux

### Terminal name/version

Alacritty / TMUX

### $TERM environment variable

tmux-256color

### Installation

system package manager

comment_data.body: Please provide a _full_ (not just a snippet from your config, a concrete file it happens with, etc.) and _minimal_ reproducing example (no lazy, no `indent` unless the bug doesn't happen without it, etc.)
Suffice it to say, I cannot reproduce this with just the three options and treesitter highlighting enabled.

I can do it with any file.. As far as a minimal config, it doesn't get more minimal than what I provided. I deleted all neovim files with:

```bash
rm -rfv "$HOME"/.local/{state,share}/nvim "$HOME"/.cache/nvim "$HOME"/.config/nvim/{lazy-lock,.luarc,package-lock}.json
```

A full config would be (I just tested with this):

```lua
local lazypath = vim.fn.stdpath('data') .. '/lazy/lazy.nvim'
local lazy_is_installed = vim.loop.fs_stat(lazypath)
if not lazy_is_installed then vim.fn.system({
	'git',
	'clone',
	'--filter=blob:none',
	'https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim.git',
	'--branch=stable',
	lazypath,
}) end
vim.opt.runtimepath:prepend(lazypath)

require('lazy').setup({
	'nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter',
	build = ':TSUpdate',
	init = function()
		vim.opt.foldenable = false
		vim.opt.foldmethod = 'expr'
		vim.opt.foldexpr = 'v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()'
	end,
	main = 'nvim-treesitter.configs',
	opts = {
		auto_install = true,
		highlight = {
			enable = true,
		},
		incremental_selection = {
			enable = true,
			keymaps = {
				init_selection = '<c-i>',
				node_incremental = '<c-i>',
				scope_incremental = false,
				node_decremental = '<bs>',
			},
		},
		indent = {
			enable = false,
		},
	},
})
```

1. Put this setup in `init.lua`, initalize a git repo, and commit the file.
2. Open init.lua in neovim, edit and save it. Leave the buffer open and visible.
3. Open a separate terminal and `git restore init.lua`
4. Go back to neovim and it will hang.

100% reproducible.

Commenting out the following lines makes the issue go away:

```lua
vim.opt.foldenable = false
vim.opt.foldmethod = 'expr'
vim.opt.foldexpr = 'v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()'
```

Can be demonstrated by commenting the lines out, opening neovim with those options not set, then repeating the steps of editing and git restore.
Does it happen with `:set noautoread`? And if not, does `:edit` then trigger it? Then try `:edit!`.

With `noautoread`, when I return to neovim, I see the following prompt:

```
W11: Warning: File "lua/plugins/treesitter.lua" has changed since editing started
See ":help W11" for more info.
[O]K, (L)oad File, Load File (a)nd Options:
```

- Upon selecting L, neovim hangs.
- If I select O instead, neovim does NOT hang. Typing `:edit` after triggers the hang.
   - If I type `:edit!` instead, neovim also hangs.

In all scenarios, disabling the following settings prevents the hang.

```lua
-- vim.opt.foldenable = false
-- vim.opt.foldmethod = 'expr'
-- vim.opt.foldexpr = 'v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()'
```

> Suffice it to say, I cannot reproduce this with just the three options and treesitter highlighting enabled.

This issue was opened because https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/24186 was closed. 

The minimal example to reproduce it remains the same (at least for me): https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/24186#issuecomment-1612109306

Using `'nvim_treesitter#foldexpr()'` instead of `'v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()'` doesn't trigger the issue.

I'm sorry I couldn't debug (bisect) this any further, I'll try doing it during the weekend.

> Using 'nvim_treesitter#foldexpr()' instead of 'v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()' doesn't trigger the issue.

Can also confirm this.

> This issue was opened because https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/24186 was closed.

That is why you should not open duplicate posts without clear indication. Can you reproduce it completely without nvim-treesitter (and lazy)?

> Using 'nvim_treesitter#foldexpr()' instead of 'v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()' doesn't trigger the issue.

That _is_ useful information. Can you bisect Neovim (you only need to checkÂ [these commits](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commits/master/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua), i.e. pass `runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua` to `git bisect`)?

> With `noautoread`, when I return to neovim, I see the following prompt: `W11: Warning: File "lua/plugins/treesitter.lua" has changed ...`

Interesting, I wouldn't have expected that with 'autoread' _disabled_. Is `vim.treesitter.foldexpr()` triggering a file read and causing a loop somehow?

> If I type `:edit!` instead, neovim also hangs.

Hmm, that suggests the `W11` prompt isn't part of the repro.

> Interesting, I wouldn't have expected that with 'autoread' disabled. Is vim.treesitter.foldexpr() triggering a file read and causing a loop somehow?

No, the file is read either automatically (with autoread) or manually (after entering `L`). Must be some sort of race between the highlighter and `foldexpr` for (re-)parsing the document when the edits are not performed by Neovim.

(Again, this is why a minimal example is needed -- can you reproduce this with _only_ `foldexpr`? Nvim-treesitter should not be part of these steps.)

> That is why you should not open duplicate posts without clear indication.

I didn't. 

In the previous issue I said that I couldn't reproduce it in `master` (at that time), that's why the issue was closed.

But then I tested in 0.9.2 when it came out and realized that the issue was still present.

> Can you reproduce it completely without nvim-treesitter (and lazy)?

The `minimal.lua` is the one I linked in my comment above, it doesn't use any plugin.

Yes, somehow I forgot to mention this in my previous posts :man_facepalming: 

> Can you bisect Neovim (you only need to check [these commits](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commits/master/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua`), i.e. pass `runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua` to `git bisect`)?

Yes, I'll do it when I can (tomorrow probably).

 The logic "to avoid infinite recursion" was already there before that PR, and I added that comment only to make it clear.
Is there a prior commit we forgot (or decided not) to backport?

@clason I learned a lot from this bug, thanks for your patience :)

- minimal config
- git bisect
- neovim treesitter core vs nvim-treesetter plugin

I was about to do a "reverse" bisect between `master` (at d2d38858d1f33a2cd92e9a6182ece2459b0d6f75) and `v0.9.0` which is the common ancestor between the `release-0.9.0` and `master` branches, when I discovered that `v0.9.0` doesn't have the issue.

So, I did a "normal" bisect between `v0.9.0`  (good) and `v0.9.4` (bad) and I found the offending commit: 1b09bcef522754452e46294a2340050f390a590b.

I tested using `VIMRUNTIME=~/devel/external/neovim/runtime ~/devel/external/neovim/build/bin/nvim --clean -u minimal.lua`.

I used to have this issue and now it is resolved for me on the current master.

There is another similar bug though that I've found only when using [fugitive.vim](https://github.com/tpope/vim-fugitive) and its `:Git log` command. I was not able to reproduce it anywhere else. Neovim does not hang indefinitely, but just takes a very long time to execute that command.

- with `vim.opt.foldexpr = "v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()"` - it hangs for 1-2 minutes before opening the log
- with `vim.opt.foldexpr = "nvim_treesitter#foldexpr()"` (or `vim.opt.foldmethod = indent`) - it opens the log immediately

title: Neovim hangs when an open buffer is modified externally and foldexpr is enabled.
